channel.title: My Aryan site thing
channel.description:
http://xto.ath.cx/aryan/
i just finished making this. its got 371 by Nerice and my modded version. i put all my scripts on thre in an archive and all on their own. my script pack has 127 scripts...mostly all from here. you'll see if you go. i dont know if this is useful at all but its there and ill prolly update it whenever i get new stuff.

item.title: My Aryan site thing
item.dc:creator: @xPLaR xPLaR
item.description:
@xPLaR wrote:

ok my site was down for a few days due to my main hd failing…i dont get it i dont even have a real server, its just a normal comp with an apache server and some server progs on it and i still get server problems lol. i dont know what was wrong with it but i just backed up the drive and chucked it out my window (i actually did throw it out my window lol). everything seems to be working fine now, but i did have to reinstall windows because it crashed so hard that like 90% of the drive got corrupted. anyways…i updated the aryan part a bit and it has the java files as well as the class files listed now, and aryan 373. if anyone wants something hosted let me know ill put it on my aryan page or u can make ur own and ill give u ftp access.

Read full topic

item.title: My Aryan site thing
item.dc:creator: @xPLaR xPLaR
item.description:
@xPLaR wrote:

kelogger…KEYLOGGER…i cant believe u i try to do something nice and i get accused of keylogging…lol im kidding i was going to put some info on it last night but i forgot to do it lol. its there now. its not much of a mod really but its what i use.

Some info on my modded version…

I didnt really mod any part of aryan or anything. i just changed my breaks and made my own Compile-All.bat.

My breaks.txt is now…

# format:
# breakName=runTime, breakLength
# where runTime and breakLength are:
# [minimum|maximum]
# if no minimum is specified, they are:
# runTimeMin = runTimeMax - runTimeMax / 4
# breakLengthMin = breakLengthMax / 2
# if a breakLength of 0 is specified, the bot
# will shutdown.

# these breaks are cyclical, meaning, once the final
# break has been taken, the handler will start over
# from the beginning. this allows the bot to run for
# an indefinite period of time, simulating a human
# schedule (albeit an addict's schedule):

# Breaks by xPLaR 

# after 2 to 3 hours, 20-30 minute break
break1=120|180, 20|30
# after 5 to 6 hours, 20-30 minute break
break2=300|360, 20|30
# after 8 to 9 hours, 20-30 minute break
break3=480|540, 20|30
# after 11 to 12 hours, 20-30 minute break
break4=660|720, 20|30
# after 14 to 15 hours, 20-30 minute break
break5=840|900, 20|30
# after 17 to 18 hours, 20-30 minute break
break6=1020|1080, 20|30
# after 20 to 21 hours, 20-30 minute break
break7=1200|1260, 20|30
# after 23 to 24 hours, 20-30 minute break
break8=1380|1440, 20|30

and my Compile-All.bat is now…

@echo off

title Compiling All (Classes, Randoms, Scripts)

echo ************************
echo * Compile All by xPLaR *
echo ************************
echo.

echo Classes...
echo Deleting .class files
cd BotClasses
del *.class
echo Done deleting .class files
echo Compiling...
javac -cp .;./../OUTPUT;./../OUTPUT/unrenamed.jar; ./../OUTPUT/*.java *.java
cd ..
echo Done Compiling
echo.

echo Randoms...
echo Deleting .class files
cd Randoms
del *.class
echo Done deleting .class files
echo Compiling...
javac -cp .;./../BotClasses;./../OUTPUT;./../OUTPUT/unrenamed.jar;./LIB/; *.java
cd ..
echo Done Compiling
echo.

echo Scripts...
echo Deleting .class files
cd Scripts
del *.class
echo Done deleting .class files
echo Compiling Scripts...
javac -cp ../LIB;.;./../BotClasses;./../OUTPUT;./../OUTPUT/unrenamed.jar; *.java
cd ..
echo Done Compiling Scripts
echo.
echo All Done, Running Aryan

Run-Bot.bat

Read full topic
